result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvatore Michele Marino III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, school, or job training and job search as available and as determined by the agent.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.   Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

  **Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.**

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.
Consecutive to: count 1 and consecutive to 14CM1243.
Concurrent with: Count 1 and concurrent with 14CF1504.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Salvatore Michele Marino in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Defense indicates this matter is close to resolving.
Defense is requesting a change of plea date.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Salvatore Michele Marino in court with attorney Gregory Reed.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft indicates that he has 2 more appointments, last appointment next week and then he will be discharged from treatment.
State does not object to an adjournment.
Defense indicates he is still working on getting discovery in this case.
BTC: Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Salvatore Michele Marino in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Chris Steenrod for Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft continues with treatment.
Deft should be completed with treatment in the middle of April.
Deft is requesting new counsel.
Counsel is moving to w/draw from the case.
BTC: Motion to w/draw is granted, new atty to be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Salvatore Michele Marino in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.

  ***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY***  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
